sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A={1, 2, 3}, B={2, 3, 4}, and C={3, 4, 5}. Calculate the following: (A △ B) × C and A △ (B × C), and prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
